channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - World

item.dc:creator: George Brandis
item.description: Britain’s “Indo-Pacific tilt” is likely to tilt back towards concerns closer to home when Labour takes the reins.
item.title: What a UK Labour government will mean for Australia’s global interests

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Residents of Copenhagen don’t understand why a small statue of The Little Mermaid is such a big deal to international visitors.
item.title: Is this the world’s most overrated tourist attraction?

item.dc:creator: Peter Baker
item.description: The deal would suspend the war in the Gaza Strip for about two months in exchange for the release of more than 100 hostages, and ease tensions in the conflict-stricken region.
item.title: Negotiators near hostage deal that would halt fighting in Gaza for weeks

item.description: A United States woman has spoken out after spending $38,000 to clone her dead cat.
item.title: US woman reveals why she spent $38,000 to clone dead cat

item.dc:creator: Marianka Swain
item.description: Monaco’s royal family may regret sacking their accountant after he pushed back against Princess Charlene’s spending. His leaked records have snowballed into a royal crisis.
item.title: The prince, the hush money and the scandal rocking Monaco

item.description: The woman shouted for help but no one below could hear her and, without her mobile phone, she spent the night rubbing her hands and feet together to stay warm.
item.title: Snowboarder trapped in ski gondola for 15 hours in freezing cold

item.description: The International Court of Justice has ruled Israel must take immediate action to prevent genocide in Gaza, but stopped short of ordering a ceasefire.
item.title: UN top court rules Israel must take immediate action to prevent genocide in Gaza

item.description: Donald Trump has been ordered by a jury to pay more than $120 million dollars to a woman he defamed.
item.title: Donald Trump ordered to pay $126 million in defamation case

item.dc:creator: Jon Gambrell and Tara Corp
item.description: The attack was the first time the Houthis directly targeted a US warship since the rebels began their Red Sea assaults on shipping in October
item.title: Houthi rebels fire at US warship, set oil tanker alight as Red Sea attacks escalate

item.dc:creator: Emma Bubola and Henrik Pryser Libell
item.description: Norway’s higher education minister Sandra Borch was responsible for making sure that students played by the rules. Students then decided to look into Borch’s own academic work.
item.title: An education minister fought plagiarism. Then she was caught copying

item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi, Edward Wong, Russell Goldman and Ronen Bergman
item.description: The UN fired 12 of its employees after accusations by Israel that they had helped plan and participated in the October 7 terrorist attack.
item.title: UN to investigate claim employees participated in October 7 attack

item.description: The resignation of the most recognisable face at WWE for decades came a day after lawsuit accusing him of serious sexual misconduct.
item.title: Wrestling icon Vince McMahon resigns from WWE after sex-trafficking claims

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: World of photos, January 28, 2024

item.description: A UK oil tanker caught fire after it was attacked by Houthis rebels in the Red Sea.
item.title: Houthis rebels strike UK oil tanker in Red Sea

item.description: The International Court of Justice urging Israel to take immediate action and prevent genocide in Gaza and improve aid, in a case field by South Africa.
item.title: Unitied Nations rule immediate action from Israel to prevent Genocide in Gaza

item.description: The White House said it was alarmed by fake online images of the pop singer and said social media companies have an important role to play in enforcing their own rules.
item.title: Deepfake pornographic images of Taylor Swift are circulating online. Her fans are fighting back

item.description: Former US President Donald Trump has been ordered by a jury to pay writer E Jean Carroll $US83.3 million ($126.65 million) in his defamation trial.
item.title: Trump ordered to pay $126 million in defamation trial

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: The civil jury in Manhattan has ordered the former US president to pay damages to E. Jean Carroll who claims he attacked her in a dressing room in the mid-1990s.
item.title: ‘A great victory for every woman’: Trump ordered to pay $127m in defamation case

item.dc:creator: Josef Federman
item.description: All sides tried to claim victory with the ruling, seizing on different elements that buttressed their positions.
item.title: The four key takeaways from World Court ruling on Israel’s war in Gaza

item.description: Jurors in Donald Trump's latest legal battle are deliberating after hearing closing statements in the E. Jean Carroll defamation trial.
item.title: Jurors deliberating in Donald Trump defamation trial
